column4: i just downloaded a program which i would like to have run automatically when the system starts. it's just a binary, no config or installer or anything. i've placed it in my home directory. what is the easiest way to make it run on system start (not on my login, but on boot)
make a script.sh and place it on /etc/init.d/scrip.sh
would script.sh just be 1 line, running the file?
yes. the path to the file that you want to execute ..i think :D
and make sure you make it executable by chmod
executable to u, g, or o?
